title: Calories in Chuck Roast
meta_description: Learn calories in chuck roast per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, sodium, and full nutrition details for this beef cut.
assumptions: Beef chuck roast, braised/cooked, separable lean and fat, trimmed to 0" external fat, no added salt or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat content, cooking method, and brand. Values are averages; check labels or USDA data for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked chuck roast provides ~271 kcal and ~26g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Lean only (separable lean, no fat trimmed)
Add 1 tsp oil for searing per 100g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g chuck roast?
faqs.a: About 271 kcal for cooked chuck roast with lean and fat.

faqs.q: Is chuck roast high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, ~26g protein per 100g, making it a good source for muscle building.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in chuck roast?
faqs.a: Around 18g total fat per 100g, with 7g saturated; trim fat to reduce.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in chuck roast?
faqs.a: Braising keeps it tender; grilling or roasting may vary slightly by moisture loss.

faqs.q: How does chuck roast compare to other beef cuts?
faqs.a: Higher fat than sirloin (~150 kcal/100g) but more flavorful; choose lean for lower calories.
